fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • One of the graphics accompanying a report about a Guardian/ICM poll gave incorrect results for a question asking whether Labour or the Conservatives would manage the economy better. The graphic plotted the results for polls taken over the past year in reverse, labelling results from December 2012 as December 2011 and vice versa. The graph should have plotted the Conservatives on 35% and Labour on 24% in December 2012 (A tarnished PM, a solid lead for Labour – but all parties told they must do better, 26 December, page 4). • The photograph used to illustrate a review of two books about the second world war battle of El Alamein did not show Field Marshal Sir Archibald Wavell, as we said, but another distinguished soldier, Field Marshal Sir John Greer Dill (How to hide your army in the sand, 22 December, page 7, Review). • An article about the closure of the Twisted Wheel club in Manchester said that Dave Fawcett had written a book about the club called The Manchester Wheelers and now runs the manchestersoul.co.uk website. That is not the case, although he has contributed to both. (Cradle of northern soul to make way for budget hotel, 28 December, page 5).
